name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxy group, a hydroxyl group, and a vinyl group. The methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +5°C. The hydroxyl group raises the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, estimated at approximately +5°C. The vinyl group introduces additional molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +5°C.
